Starting the merge since its needed for https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/121. Do please open another pull request if any of the above comments needs further changes.

This pull-request was updated incorrectly, which makes it impossible for reviewers to know what was changed when it was updated. Please do _not_ use git rebase or git commit --amend when updating an existing pull request. Make it as new commits instead. Thanks.
Steve, what should be done with this request now? Should it be abandoned and a new request submitted?
Looks good to me. Just go ahead and commit it once tests pass.
Fixing the history back to multiple commits is difficult at best. So this will have to be reviewed as is. My comment is guidance for future changes to this or other pull requests.
OK. So, what you're saying is these changes will be hard to review using this particular tool but it might still be OK to proceed with this pull request.
@DaveBirdsall  correct

Sorry about that Steve. 

The packaging script expects filename ending with .0. Could you also do the following ? 

Sorry for the trouble and thanks.
1. cd $TOOLSDIR/icu4.4/linux64/lib
2. ln -s libicudataNv44.so.44.0     libicudata.so.44.0
3. ln -s libicuucNv44.so.44.0        libicuuc.so.44.0

Thanks Steve - that seems to have worked.
Test Failed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/23/

Hi RuoYu, 

Could you please work with Steve and check which icu library file the driver is not able to find during runtime ? The location of the files for that particular test is /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/odbc_driver.

Thanks

Hi RuoYu, 

Most probably the workaround of linking to keep both versions may not work, since the soname remains with suffix Nv44. Suggest to generate the icu lib directory utilizing the steps in traf_tools_setup.sh (modified) and move those to $TOOLSDIR/icu4.4/linux64/lib (or it might be possible to generate in existing directory). Please test this out so that both libraries exist and provide steps for Steve to execute.

I looked at the following:
http://userguide.icu-project.org/packaging

Thanks

The driver links libicudata.so and libicuuc.so, without any .44 nor .0 ending, have you checked that these 2 still have Nv44 suffix?
The symbolic links should be created like below:
ln -s libicudata.so.44.0 libicudata.so
ln -s libicuuc.so.44.0 libicuuc.so

Could you please check that?

You might be right RuoYu. Could you please test this out in your environment with and without the suffix and let Steve know all the steps he should be doing. For example:

cd $TOOLSDIR/icu4.4/linux64/lib
rm -f libicudata.so.44.0
rm -f libicudata.so.44
rm -f libicudata.so
ln -s libicudataNv44.so.44.0 libicudata.so.44.0
ln -s libicudata.so.44.0 libicudata.so.44
ln -s libicudata.so.44.0 libicudata.so

rm -f libicuuc.so.44.0
rm -f libicuuc.so.44
rm -f libicuuc.so
ln -s libicuucNv44.so.44.0 libicuuc.so.44.0
ln -s libicuuc.so.44.0 libicuuc.so.44
ln -s libicuuc.so.44.0 libicuuc.so

I think if this is to be done on one system and then propagated, then just doing the configure/make/make check/make install without suffix and getting it installed in the existing target directory may be a safer way. 

Do please test in your environment, suggest steps to Steve and followup on the test failures/success.

Thanks

Hi Arvind,
We tested this updated traf_tools_setup.sh script to setup a new machine that day I update this PR, it just ran perfectly fine. And Weiqing used the symbolic link to setup and run make on a new machine again, succeeded.  The links were created just like listed above.

The traf_tools_setup.sh has the steps of configure/make/make check/make install already, if you take a look you will the steps. And I just ran it again without the suffix, everything runs good.

PS: the traf_tools_setup.sh needs sudo privilege to run if the TOOLSDIR is set to /opt/home/tools, otherwise make install of all additional tools will fail. It's out of the concern of this discussion anyway, but we better document that in wiki.

Regards

@ryzuo, I can't just run the script and install the result. The test machines must be backward compatible to work with current versions of code.  So the lib directory must have both the old and new library names.  

Currently they have this set up:
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuucNv44.so -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuucNv44.so.44 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 svarnau svarnau  5968571 Dec  7  2013 libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so.44 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so.44.0 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0

Why won't this work?

@svarnau Do you create the link libicudata.so too ? If you give the error message , we can find the reason. We can't just guess the reason.
Bye the way RuoYu's solution works for me.

The latest test got further than previous. The test log shows:
('01000', "[01000] [unixODBC][Driver Manager]Can't open lib '/home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/odbc_driver/libtrafodbc_drvr64.so' : file not found (0) (SQLDriverConnect)")

It looks to me like something is looking for the shared lib in the location were it was built, and not the location where odbc driver was installed.

No, I don't have that quite right. it is not built in that location, but the pyodbc tests set it up there. Not sure exactly why it gives error, perhaps there is something in that test script that needs to change as well.  Give the pyodbc tests a try to see if you can reproduce it.
Merging. Thanks

I am getting this error. Will try again tomorrow or get help.
error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 100

@svarnau We could do an ldd on libtradodbc_drvr64.so file - that will show if it is looking for *Nv44 suffix still.

@svarnau Could you try out the set of commands I gave earlier ? It does maintain backward compatibility. Previous version just looks for the following and that is not being touched. We are adding another link to *Nv44.so.44.0 files so that we have the same setup for *icuuc.so and *icudata.so. This setup was tested by @ryzuo and @xwq as per the discussion earlier. 

lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       22 Oct 15 00:19 libicudataNv44.so -> libicudataNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau       22 Oct 15 00:19 libicudataNv44.so.44 -> libicudataNv44.so.44.0
-rw-r--r--. 1 svarnau svarnau 14924889 Dec  7  2013 libicudataNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau      20 Oct 15 00:19 libicuucNv44.so -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau      20 Oct 15 00:19 libicuucNv44.so.44 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 svarnau svarnau 5968571 Dec  7  2013 libicuucNv44.so.44.0

@ryzuo and @xwq  you can look at the log files via - test name->Console Output -> click on detailed logs link - that basically has all the logs and relevant information saved. Under that you'll have logs where this particular test stores the files used and output.

http://traf-logs.esgyn.com/PullReq/96/23/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/
http://traf-logs.esgyn.com/PullReq/96/23/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/logs/

Basically need something similar to the following (4th and 5th line edited):
Similar for libicudata.
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau 20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuucNv44.so -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau 20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuucNv44.so.44 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0
-rwxr-xr-x. 1 svarnau svarnau 5968571 Dec 7 2013 libicuucNv44.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau 20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so -> libicuuc.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau 20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so.44 -> libicuuc.so.44.0
lrwxrwxrwx. 1 svarnau svarnau 20 Oct 15 00:25 libicuuc.so.44.0 -> libicuucNv44.so.44.0

Hi, Arvind and Steve

If you look into the make.log(close to bottom of the entire log), you will see the odbc driver has already been made succesfully:
http://traf-logs.esgyn.com/PullReq/96/23/build-master-debug/Make.log

So this failure is not related to this change.

I went to take a look at the test install log:
http://traf-logs.esgyn.com/PullReq/96/23/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/console.html

And I noticed the driver is install at /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/clients/odbc", but if you look into the odbcinst.ini configuration, you will see the driver dir is specified at "/home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/odbc_driver/". The setup of  the test environment is incorrect.

Could you please double check the test setup scripts and the machine? I don't see this is in git repo, this is what I can tell just from the log.

Thanks& Regards
RuoYu

Hi RuoYu,

This test is working fine in daily builds. Do check the console output where a link is established. File not found error seen in the test logs I believe is due to some missing .so file - in this case _Nv44_ - my guess - we could do a ldd to confirm. Should be easy to simulate if you use the current files on /opt/home/tools.
- cd /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests
- mkdir /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/logs
- rm -rf /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/odbc_driver
- ln -s /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/clients/odbc /home/jenkins/workspace/pyodbc_test-cm5.3/trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests/odbc_driver

Hi Arvind and Steve

I use unixODBC, which is used by pyodbc, to simulated this on my box, it just runs fine, I don't see the error. Could you please check is there's only one copy of ICU libs in the Jenkins box?

Sorry... mouse jumping......

Could you please make sure the driver is installed successfully? And also please double check is the ICU libs are in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and also, please make sure there's no other copy messes it up.

I ldd checked the lib file, just everything it needs are all in:
[zuor@zuor-centos-v64 install]$ ldd libtrafodbc_drvr64.so
        linux-vdso.so.1 =>  (0x00007ffcb9065000)
        libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007f6420a4d000)
        librt.so.1 => /lib64/librt.so.1 (0x00007f6420844000)
        libdl.so.2 => /lib64/libdl.so.2 (0x00007f6420640000)
        libz.so.1 => /lib64/libz.so.1 (0x00007f642042a000)
        libicuuc.so.44 => ./libicuuc.so.44 (0x00007f64200cd000)
        libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007f641fdc7000)
        libm.so.6 => /lib64/libm.so.6 (0x00007f641fb43000)
        libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib64/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007f641f92c000)
        libc.so.6 => /lib64/libc.so.6 (0x00007f641f598000)
        /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007f64211b2000)
        libicudata.so.44 => ./libicudata.so.44 (0x00007f641e55c000)

I don't have pyodbc on hand by now, so I compiled the connect_test.cpp sample file with unixODBC Driver Manager, which is used by pyodbc:
g++ -g -L./ -lodbc -o test connect_test.cpp
and ran a test, anyway, everything runs fine on my system... I have no idea what went wrong on Jenkins... It still might be some env setup issue.
Test Passed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/24/

pyodbc tests are part of the incubator-trafodion tree, You can find the pyodbc tests in incubator-trafodion/dcs/src/test/pytests. It is very simple to run.  There is a README that provide instructions on how to run it else if you have updated your branch to pick the latest codebase helper scripts are provided to run the test in your environment(swpyodbc)

My suggestion would be keep the set certificate directory code so we can provide an alternate location  for storing the client certificates rather than asking the customer to update the registry whenever ODBC driver installation is done.
My recommendation would be to create the DLL during the build step to c:\Build\winodbc64...\lib folder so we can eliminate the  additional copy step in build_os.bat file
Done. Did not get the error this morning.
Test Passed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/25/

I think your environment for $TOOLSDIR files is a bit different than others,possibly because of the setup script run earlier. Do look at the current env posted by Steve and the link I posted for icu packaging - what .so file information is used at compile and link time. Current env we are still getting Nv44 when -licuuc is done. Either for build and runtime env we need to do the steps I mentioned earlier for linking or we need to install without suffix so that both versions are available in the target directory linux64/lib

Subject: Re: [incubator-trafodion] [TRAFODION-1514] Stop using custom suffix(Nv44) of ICU libs. (#96)

Looks good. Thanks for the change. I can merge it in if no issues are found in the next few hours.
Test Passed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/26/
jenkins, retest -- I've changed the symlinks per Arvind's suggestion.

@xwq Suggestion by @hegdean are valid -
1.  It will be better to keep set certificate directory code in place so that customer can specify where to store the certificate. Inno setup script didn't handle this earlier but this needs to be put in place. 
2. C:\Build\winodbc64 should not be hard coded in our code/installation steps. There is %PACKDIR% defined that should be used.  Installer.iss should take in a parameter so that the hard coded location can be removed. Same should be used in build_os.bat - we currently use only in one step. Do also please update the comments in README.txt to match the definition of PACKDIR - currently it says to point to the source.

I know you have made it easy for the user to install the windows driver - really appreciate  your contribution - but we also need to make sure that the instructions are clear and works for all sites - hence should avoid hard coded locations. Any steps we need to make the installation work should be clearly specified in the README.txt
Changes look great. Thanks for making explain more reliable.

Looks good! Nice refactoring that will help with future code maintenance!

last attempt was with generation of icu library files without suffix. This one failed because of incompatible glibc between runtime system (glibc 2.12) and where icu was compiled (glibc 2.15). Steve will be recompiling and installing icu. Thanks a lot Steve for your help and patience.
jenkins, retest -- icu rebuild done and propagated again
Looks correct, but do we need similar checks in put/delete<list of>?
Test Failed.  https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/32/

Hi Sean.  Yes, I added the checkRow for both the list of puts/deletes and single put/delete.  The put(List) actually calls the put(single) in the code so the checkRow on line 3935 covers both cases.  As for delete, single delete is line 3641 and delete(List) is line 3661.
Got it.  This looks fine.  Thanks Oliver.

@ryzuo - Do please see how we can maintain backward compatibility with the change submitted. Currently because we have the include files from Nv44 suffix and the lib from the default icu the generated driver is giving error while compiling ( connect_test.cpp ) or running ( via python ). Do check if introducing some env variable will help or some other way we can maintain this backward compatibility.
No, I can change it so we accept any 3.x Maven version and install 3.3.3 if we don't find any. I just picked 3.0.5 because that's what's installed on my machine.
Perhaps a different path instead of TOOLSDIR/icu4.4 would work.  If the new non-suffix libs were in different location?
